Package com.ibm.security.verifysdk

Class KeyStoreHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.security.verifysdk.KeyStoreHelper
  • @RequiresApi(23)
public final class KeyStoreHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper class to perform key management and signing operations. https://developer.android.com/training/articles/keystore
    Since:
    2.0.0
    Version:
    2.1.5
    Due to a potential bug with the SHA512withRSA algorithm on a Nexus 5x with Android 6 https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=210237, we use SHA256withRSA

    • Method Detail

      • createKeyPair

        public static void createKeyPair​(@NonNull
                                 java.lang.String keyName,
                                 @NonNull
                                 java.lang.String algorithm,
                                 boolean authenticationRequired,
                                 @NonNull
                                 IResultCallback<java.security.PublicKey> callback)
        Generates a private and public key to sign data. An existing key pair with the same alias will be deleted.

        The key size is specific to provided algorithm and could be looked up from the algorithm-specific parameters via setAlgorithmParameterSpec.

        Parameters:
        keyName - the unique identifier of the key pair
        algorithm - the standard string name of the algorithm to generate the key pair
        authenticationRequired - indicates whether the generated key requires authentication (fingerprint) in order to get access to it.
        callback - the function delegate that is invoked with the PublicKey and VerifySdkException.

      • createKeyPair

        public static void createKeyPair​(@NonNull
                                 java.lang.String keyName,
                                 @NonNull
                                 java.lang.String algorithm,
                                 boolean authenticationRequired,
                                 boolean invalidatedByBiometricEnrollment,
                                 @NonNull
                                 IResultCallback<java.security.PublicKey> callback)
        Generates a private and public key to sign data. An existing key pair with the same alias will be deleted.

        The key size is specific to provided algorithm and could be looked up from the algorithm-specific parameters via setAlgorithmParameterSpec.

        Parameters:
        keyName - the unique identifier of the key pair
        algorithm - the standard string name of the algorithm to generate the key pair
        authenticationRequired - indicates whether the generated key requires authentication (fingerprint) in order to get access to it.
        invalidatedByBiometricEnrollment - indicates whether the key should be invalidated on biometric enrollment. This is only supported since API level 24 (Nougat). For further details please see setInvalidatedByBiometricEnrollment
        callback - the function delegate that is invoked with the PublicKey and VerifySdkException.

                                 @NonNull
                                 IResultCallback<java.lang.Boolean> callback)
        Delete a private and public key from the KeyStore.
        Parameters:
        keyName - the unique identifier of the key pair
        callback - the function delegate that is invoked with the success flag indicate if the key pair has been successfully deleted and VerifySdkException

      • exportPublicKey

        @NonNull
public static java.lang.String exportPublicKey​(@NonNull
                                               java.lang.String keyName)
                                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the public key retrieved from the keystore in Privacy Enhanced Mail (PEM) format.
        Parameters:
        keyName - the unique identifier of the key pair
        Returns:
        Privacy Enhanced Mail (PEM) representation of the key in Base64.DEFAULT encoding
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any argument is null.

      • exportPublicKey

        @NonNull
public static java.lang.String exportPublicKey​(@NonNull
                                               java.lang.String keyName,
                                               int base64EncodingOptions)
                                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the public key retrieved from the keystore in Privacy Enhanced Mail (PEM) format.
        Parameters:
        keyName - the unique identifier of the key pair
        base64EncodingOptions - the flag controls certain features of the encoded output as described at https://developer.android.com/reference/android/util/Base64#constants
        Returns:
        Privacy Enhanced Mail (PEM) representation of the key or
        an empty string if the key could not be retrieved from the Keystore
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if keyName is null or base64EncodingOptions out of range.

        Returns:
        the type of keystore

      • hasAuthenticationSettingsChanged

        public static boolean hasAuthenticationSettingsChanged​(@NonNull
                                                       java.lang.String keyNameForChangeCheck,
                                                       @NonNull
                                                       java.lang.String algorithm)
        Checks if the authentication settings have changed since the key was created.

        It uses the occurance of a KeyPermanentlyInvalidatedException as an indication whether the user has done one of the following:

        • added another fingerprint
        • removed all fingerprints
        • disabled the secure lock screen
        • the secure lock screen has been forcibely reseted

        As described here, that will irreversibly invalidate keys.

        The key to check should be created with the following settings:

        • KeyProperties#PURPOSE_SIGN
        • KeyGenParameterSpec.Builder#setUserAuthenticationRequired(boolean) as true
        • KeyGenParameterSpec.Builder#setUserAuthenticationValidityDurationSeconds(int) as -1
        • KeyGenParameterSpec.Builder#setInvalidatedByBiometricEnrollment(boolean) as true

        createKeyPair(String, String, boolean, IResultCallback) will create a key that fulfills these requirements.

        The observed behaviour through testing is not in line with the documentation here. Apparently the key gets only permanently invalidated when a fingerprint is added, but not when all fingerprints have been removed nor when the Secure Lock Screen has been disabled.

        As long as this state remains, these settings can be checked with isDeviceSecure and hasEnrolledFingerprint.

        Parameters:
        keyNameForChangeCheck - the name of the key used for the checking.
        algorithm - the standard string name of the algorithm used to create the signature
        Returns:
        • true if the key could be found in the keystore and the user has done one of the actions mentioned above since the key was created
        • false otherwise

      • signData

        @Nullable
public static java.lang.String signData​(@NonNull
                                        java.lang.String keyName,
                                        @NonNull
                                        java.lang.String algorithm,
                                        @NonNull
                                        java.lang.String value)
        Using a key generated by the device to sign the value and return the encrypted result.
        Parameters:
        keyName - the unique identifier of the key pair
        algorithm - the standard string name of the algorithm used to create the signature
        value - the string to encrypt
        Returns:
        • the base64 signed data or
        • null if the value can not be signed

                                        java.lang.String value,
                                        int base64EncodingOptions)

        Parameters:
        keyName - the unique identifier of the key pair
        algorithm - the standard string name of the algorithm used to create the signature
        value - the string to encrypt
        base64EncodingOptions - the flag controls certain features of the encoded output
        Returns:
        • the base64 signed data or
        • null if the value can not be signed

                                         java.lang.String keyName)
        Returns true if the keystore could be loaded and a key with the given name found.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        • false otherwise

      • signData

        public static java.lang.String signData​(@NonNull
                                        androidx.biometric.BiometricPrompt.AuthenticationResult authenticationResult,
                                        @NonNull
                                        java.lang.String value,
                                        int base64EncodingOptions)
        Using an authorized key generated by the device to sign the value and return the encrypted result.
        Parameters:
        authenticationResult - the BiometricPrompt.AuthenticationResult instance that holds the authorized key for the signing
        value - the string to encrypt
        base64EncodingOptions - the flag controls certain features of the encoded output
        Returns:
        • the base64 signed data or
        • null if the value can not be signed
        Since:
        2.0.5

      • signData

        @Deprecated
public static java.lang.String signData​(@NonNull
                                        android.hardware.fingerprint.FingerprintManager.AuthenticationResult authenticationResult,
                                        @NonNull
                                        java.lang.String value,
                                        int base64EncodingOptions)
        Deprecated.
        Method is deprecated because FingerprintManager is deprecated. Use signData(BiometricPrompt.AuthenticationResult, String, int) instead.
        Using an authorized key generated by the device to sign the value and return the encrypted result.
        Parameters:
        authenticationResult - the FingerprintManager.AuthenticationResult instance that holds the authorized key for the signing
        value - the string to encrypt
        base64EncodingOptions - the flag controls certain features of the encoded output
        Returns:
        • the base64 signed data or
        • null if the value can not be signed
